comments.body:
It seems that `bump` and `pyopencl` are only required if some [`extras`](https://github.com/SasView/sasmodels/blob/8803a3853d8388dbec0845dd84f394341fb00041/setup.py#L69) are installed, which you are currently not doing. Please decide what you want :)

Also, there seems to be a [Windows-only dependency](https://github.com/SasView/sasmodels/blob/8803a3853d8388dbec0845dd84f394341fb00041/setup.py#L34) that needs to be added.

> It seems that bump and pyopencl are only required if some extras are installed, which you are currently not doing. Please decide what you want :)

Does it matter that I am not modifying the `build.script` command to add the extras? Pip won't be used to install the extra packages anyway right?
The `tinycc` windows dependency is not installable via conda at the moment. It isn't necessary anyway if the system has OpenCL support.
Could you please also add a `description` here?
A description is not absolutely needed.
